data.text: Testing could be key in the fight against #COVID19. New IMF staff research finds that global #GDP losses could shrink to 3.3% if half of asymptomatic infectious people are identified and isolated. That's compared to a drop of 15% with no testing. #IMFBlog https://t.co/0lEWrNKNi8 https://t.co/ZCKZuINTBp

Our latest issue of F&D magazine focuses on jobs and opportunities. Thoughtful pieces by @KGeorgieva, @HBoushey, @MESandbu, @BCAppelbaum, @sabinadewan and many more. https://t.co/tLc5k4OrTL #IMFBlog #FandD https://t.co/h7OCx7j1yL
Wealth is often a key building block for more wealth. Our new #ChartOfTheWeek dives into tax records to show just how this works. https://t.co/XKAg8e2mfd #IMFBlog https://t.co/izS3hQtfkT

What does the future hold for jobs and opportunity? Our new issue of #FandD magazine, produced in partnership with 
@WEF, explores the transformative policies needed to reimagine the world of work and reduce #inequality. https://t.co/1LDHlm7KJq

Speaking at the #FTBanking summit, @KGeorgieva commended the Common Framework for debt endorsed by the #G20 to help vulnerable countries with unsustainable debt, and highlighted the importance of acting fast. https://t.co/jko0s7ILe9

As robots take over work previously performed by people, what is the #futureofjobs? In today’s Richard Goode lecture, @DrDaronAcemoglu & @KGeorgieva discussed how automation could worsen #inequality.
Watch the replay:
 
https://t.co/Pv4oMJkg9f https://t.co/LOHovs8TjP
Smart, #greeninvestment can help jump-start the economic recovery. What’s the role for governments? Read more on #IMFBlog https://t.co/r0rrK0BCF9 https://t.co/xYKMxyn8BZ

Watch the replay of our sixth annual Richard Goode Lecture here: 

https://t.co/Pv4oMJkg9f https://t.co/8HDxT7BQSI

LIVE: The 6th Richard Goode Lecture: “Remaking the Post-COVID World.” 

Presented by Professor @DrDaronAcemoglu, this lecture examines the relationship between technological change and inclusive economic growth. https://t.co/pOg0xX41va https://t.co/Pv4oMJkg9f

Wealthy people are more likely to earn higher returns on investments and not just high-risk ones. Research by IMF staff finds the rich also make more on conservative investments. Read more on why in our new #IMFBlog https://t.co/XKAg8e2mfd https://t.co/za7tkfh4Bc

The most important policy issue in 2021 is going to be vaccines –but they are not a magic wand. We need to manage policy support carefully to cushion the transition for firms and workers, said IMF Chief @Kgeorgieva during her talk with @BW @joelwebershow at #Bloomberg50. https://t.co/3po3r5oCkz

New policies that center on rebuilding worker bargaining power are needed to reestablish patterns of growth that benefit the majority, economist Lawrence Mishel (@LarryMishel) writes in the latest #FandD. Read more here: https://t.co/lhilqsRj8V https://t.co/3GK7chnM4V

The #COVID19 pandemic has had an unequal impact on the rich and poor. IMF staff research finds that cheap and rapid testing could save lives and avert economic losses, especially among the less well off. Read more in the latest #IMFBlog. https://t.co/0lEWrNKNi8

At the #FTBanking summit, @KGeorgieva shared with @martinwolf_ two areas where global cooperation is essential at this time:
1️⃣ Providing access to vaccines and improving health systems
2️⃣ Increasing resilience and limiting scarring from the crisis https://t.co/PzXvvrhdZ7
.@KGeorgieva at #Bloomberg50: COVID-19 has increased the risks of inequalities both within and across countries. We must join forces to avoid a “tale of two cities.” https://t.co/D3ZEaLUP4V

IMF Managing Director @Kgeorgieva joins @BW @joelwebershow to discuss the Institution’s challenges and successes under the #COVID19 reshaped economic landscape and the road ahead. #Bloomberg50
https://t.co/hy6zGkqEYd

With the COVID-19 pandemic #Colombia has drawn US$ 5.4 billion under the Flexible Credit Line (FCL) arrangement to help meet higher financing needs while maintaining its strong external buffers in the face of heightened global uncertainty. #IMFAmericas https://t.co/H4vTLvL5Kj

The COVID-19 crisis has highlighted growing inequality across the world. In the latest issue of #FandD, leading progressive economist Heather Boushey (@HBoushey) proposes steps to reduce inequality and transform the US economy. https://t.co/uD47QGbec1 https://t.co/kBIBg2ABHv

Policymakers’ choices during this disruption could shape their economies for decades to come, writes the FT’s @MESandbu in F&D’s new December issue. Find out how in “The Post-Pandemic Brave New World.” https://t.co/vbuV3TC7z1 #FandD https://t.co/y2WkvF6Ogq

JOIN US DEC 4, 10:30 AM (ET) for the sixth annual Richard Goode Lecture: “Remaking the Post-COVID World.” 
Presented by Professor @DrDaronAcemoglu, this lecture examines the relationship between technological change and inclusive economic growth.
https://t.co/pOg0xX41va https://t.co/ofJIkjIG6y

The #COVID19 pandemic has hit the poor harder both in terms of death rates and economic harm. A recent IMF staff analysis shows that fatalities could drop 73% among the less well off with better testing. #IMFBlog https://t.co/0lEWrNKNi8 https://t.co/erRZf7M2go

#COVID19 has fundamentally reshaped the global economic landscape. IMF Chief @KGeorgieva will join @BW @joelwebershow to talk about the Institution’s challenges & successes in 2020 & the road ahead. #Bloomberg50 @BloombergLive

Watch live today at 3pm ET: https://t.co/RFp2b992Ug https://t.co/wRB6tqq7zz

Policies must focus on creating higher-quality jobs for more people. Read the latest issue of #FandD magazine that looks at the future of jobs and economic opportunity. https://t.co/tLc5k562Lj #IMFBlog https://t.co/YyYkQvo6fC

Did you know that countries can lose over 1/3 of potential benefits from infrastructure investment due to inefficiencies? Check out our new portal aimed at helping countries improve the quality of their investments in infrastructure. 
 
https://t.co/b69PCkmG0A https://t.co/3PTP2XDfBB
Our latest Annual Report builds a strong case for confronting the climate crisis while building an equitable recovery. Learn more https://t.co/6TkZJ7SaxD https://t.co/mgqwiq13WX

#ArtificialIntelligence could cause a growing divergence between rich and poor countries. #Policymakers in developing economies will need to take actions to raise productivity and improve skills. Read more in our latest #IMFBlog https://t.co/uAlyzmufn4 https://t.co/2UXElyCJYa

When is a sovereign debt restructuring needed? And why can sovereign debt restructurings be difficult to achieve? 

📙 Learn more about the main challenges and how the IMF can facilitate a solution. https://t.co/HBjdqsdkdc https://t.co/yH7dwZj0v0

The COVID-19 crisis could wipe out inequality improvements that emerging markets and developing economies have made since 2008. https://t.co/YpIkNBcRl5 #IMFBlog https://t.co/vzRM9x9flU

Microfinance institutions provide women around the world better access to banking services. For example, in Bangladesh, 90% of #microfinance borrowers are women. Take a look at the IMF’s latest Financial Access Survey. https://t.co/1NFRSxZlil #IMFGender #FinancialInclusion https://t.co/IVLVuydBSt

Tunisia’s newly redesigned 10-dinar banknote honors Tawhida Ben Cheikh (1909–2010), the country’s first female physician. Learn more in #FandD's latest “Currency Notes” article: https://t.co/FtfvfKGT1h https://t.co/hvSy9PxQ09

#AsiaPacific is recovering from its worst recession. Our latest Regional Economic Outlook shows that a rebound started in the third quarter, but growth engines are not all firing with the same power across countries, leading to a multispeed recovery.  https://t.co/XqK4NfIESy https://t.co/HkrLlvo6TC

Countries should avoid a premature withdrawal of vital support for people and businesses as unemployment remains high. Some economies need more fiscal support in 2021 beyond what is currently budgeted. Read the #IMFBlog by @KGeorgieva. https://t.co/1FUyGvb8Lb https://t.co/6alt89eWfW

The pandemic has put intense pressure on economies across sub-Saharan Africa. On @imf_podcast, Papa N'Diaye talks about the region's outlook and policies needed for a resilient recovery. https://t.co/DrxhFPJRyC #IMFAfrica https://t.co/wPmKgsTAcM

IMF’s Deputy Managing Director Zhang at @WomenLeadersGF: Financial inclusion of women, supported by #fintech, is one of the best ways to increase growth and reduce inequality after the crisis. https://t.co/igBlwxnbCR #IMFGender https://t.co/nUEQsiuTEO

The pandemic presents the greatest opportunity to enhance people’s lives. Governments, the private sector, international organizations & citizens must take up the challenge to increase digitalization & dare to make a difference. More on #IMFBlog: https://t.co/whUQMs9tdy https://t.co/vEmK5eNuOI

Largely unknown outside central #Africa, African forest elephants contribute to natural carbon capture—something of tremendous value to societies and to economies, writes IMF’s Ralph Chami in a new article for #FandD: https://t.co/kELmBsa266 #climatechange https://t.co/SnGhjpZWIx

#SovereignDebt restructurings present an important opportunity to include disaster relief clauses, which can provide valuable insurance from default to vulnerable countries. More in the new staff research. https://t.co/I8hfBPiYTc https://t.co/UUSA8ljuSJ
Exceptional times require exceptional action. Learn more about the IMF’s response to COVID-19 in our latest Annual Report.  https://t.co/43YWyKZWBH https://t.co/je1ItFJ2i1
